data.text: How does the city that was filled with people sit solitary!
She weeps sore in the night,
Judea is gone into captivity by reason of her affliction,
The ways of Zion mourn,
Her oppressors are become the head,
And all her beauty has been taken away
Jerusalem remembered the days of her affliction,
Jerusalem has sinned a great sin;
Her uncleanness is before her feet;
The oppressor has stretched out his hand
All her people groan,
All ye that pass by the way,
He has sent fire from his lofty habitation,
He has watched over my sins,
The Lord has cut off
Mine eye has poured out water,
Zion has spread out her hand,
The Lord is righteous;
I called my lovers,
Behold, O Lord; for I am afflicted:
Hear, I pray you, for I groan:
Let all their wickedness come before thy face;
